questions.question: What is the highest acetylene uptake value achieved by Cu2(PDDI) at 273 K and 1 bar?
What are the two types of functional sites present in the Cu2(PDDI) framework?
questions.answer: Open metal sites and Lewis basic pyridyl sites

questions.question: What is the BET surface area and pore volume of activated ZJU-5a?
How does the acetylene storage capacity of ZJU-5a at 273 K compare to its capacity at room temperature?
questions.answer: The acetylene storage capacity at 273 K is higher than at room temperature.

questions.question: What role do the open metal sites play in the storage of acetylene and methane in ZJU-5a?
questions.answer: The open metal sites serve as strong binding sites for the storage of acetylene and methane.

questions.question: Is the methane storage capacity of ZJU-5a at 35 bar higher than the DOE's old target of 180 cm3 (STP) cm-3?
Does the acetylene storage capacity of ZJU-5a at 273 K and 1 bar surpass all previously reported porous materials?

questions.answer: Hydrochloric acid is added to the mixture during the synthesis process, but the specific role is not detailed in the provided text.

questions.question: Does the structure of ZJU-5 include disordered lattice DMF and water molecules?
Is the BET surface area of ZJU-5a lower than 2000 m2/g?
What is the crystal system of ZJU-5?
How does the methane storage capacity of ZJU-5a at 60 bar compare to its capacity at 35 bar?
questions.answer: The methane storage capacity at 60 bar is higher than at 35 bar.

questions.question: What is the significance of the open Cu2+ sites in ZJU-5's structure for gas storage?
questions.answer: The open Cu2+ sites are crucial for recognizing and binding gas molecules, enhancing the storage capacity.
